qas.question: Where do the Blue Ridge Mountains begin?
What are the typical elevations of the Blue Ridge Mountains?
How tall are the Blue Ridge Mountains in Virginia?
What is the tallest Appalachian mountain in Virginia?
What mountain is just above the Mason-Dixon line?
What state is the Potomac River in?
What is the highest peak south of the Roanoke River?
What is the lowest point in the commonwealth?
What is the highest mountain in Pennsylvania?

context: The Blue Ridge Mountains, rising in <a0_0>southern Pennsylvania<a0_0/> and there known as South Mountain, attain elevations of about <a1_0>2,000 ft<a1_0/> (600 m) in that state. South Mountain achieves its highest point just below the Mason-Dixon line in <b6_0>Maryland<b6_0/> at <b5_0><b9_0>Quirauk Mountain<b9_0/><b5_0/> <a2_0>2,145 ft<a2_0/> (654 m) and then diminishes in height southward to the Potomac River. Once in Virginia the Blue Ridge again reaches <a3_0>2,000 ft<a3_0/> (600 m) and higher. In the Virginia Blue Ridge, the following are some of the highest peaks north of the Roanoke River: Stony Man 4,031 ft (1,229 m), Hawksbill Mountain 4,066 ft (1,239 m), <b7_0>Apple Orchard Mountain<b7_0/> 4,225 ft (1,288 m) and Peaks of Otter 4,001 and 3,875 ft (1,220 and 1,181 m). South of the Roanoke River, along the Blue Ridge, are Virginia's highest peaks including <b8_0>Whitetop Mountain<b8_0/> 5,520 ft (1,680 m) and <a4_0>Mount Rogers<a4_0/> 5,729 ft (1,746 m), the highest point in the Commonwealth.
